abstract.p: Canada's Scotiabank and Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce report solid growth for second quarter; operating profit at Canadian Imperial rose 43 percent, to 461 million Canadian dollars, about $309 million; income doubled to 676 million Canadian dollars, or $453 million; Scotiabank reports 21 percent increase in profit, to 465 million Canadian dollars (S)

block.p: Canada's third- and fourth-largest banks, Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce and Scotiabank, reported solid growth for the second quarter, extending a trend set two weeks ago by their bigger rivals. Operating profit at C.I.B.C. rose 43 percent, to 461 million Canadian dollars, about $309 million. Including gains from selling shares of Global Crossing Ltd., a telecommunications company, and its real estate portfolio, C.I.B.C.'s income doubled to 676 million Canadian dollars, or $453 million. Scotiabank reported a 21 percent increase in profit, to 465 million Canadian dollars.

Canada's third- and fourth-largest banks, Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce and Scotiabank, reported solid growth for the second quarter, extending a trend set two weeks ago by their bigger rivals. Operating profit at C.I.B.C. rose 43 percent, to 461 million Canadian dollars, about $309 million. Including gains from selling shares of Global Crossing Ltd., a telecommunications company, and its real estate portfolio, C.I.B.C.'s income doubled to 676 million Canadian dollars, or $453 million. Scotiabank reported a 21 percent increase in profit, to 465 million Canadian dollars.
